alert.note: Alert for Jackson; Mason; Wood (West Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued February 04 at 5:07AM EST by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 AM EST THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...Portions of southeast Ohio and West Virginia, including the following counties, in southeast Ohio, Athens, Gallia, Jackson, Meigs, Morgan, Vinton and Washington. In West Virginia, Jackson, Mason and Wood. * WHEN...Until 1000 AM EST. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, large creeks, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. Numerous roads remain closed due to flooding. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 506 AM EST, local law enforcement reported ongoing flooding across the warned area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. Symmes Creek is flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Parkersburg, Athens, Marietta, Belpre, Jackson, Wellston, Nelsonville, Point Pleasant, Gallipolis, Pomeroy, Glouster, Mcarthur, Oak Hill, Beverly, Rio Grande, Albany, Racine, Coolville, Rutland and Chesterhill. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Report Severe Weather to the National Weather Service by calling toll free, 800 401 9535, when you can do so safely.
